body.directions: Please read the phrases in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be completed with the word presented?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! 会 huì means "to know how to," and it can fit well in the 2nd sentence in the choices 我会画画。Wǒhuìhuàhuà. (I can draw.)
body.incorrect: Almost. Identify the meaning of the word, and then try it with the sentences in the choices to see which one fits the best.

body.quiz: In which of the following classes can the verb presented be associated with?
body.correct: Job excellently done! The word 画 huà means "to draw," and it’s a common activity in an 艺术课 yìshùkè (art class).
body.incorrect: Not quite…think about the activity represented by the word presented; then consider in which class in the choices you will most likely do it.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not have the same initial as the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 或是 huòshì
options: Audio for 学生 shēng
Audio for 下午 xiàwǔ
Audio for 需要 xūyào
body.correct: Outstanding! 写 xiě (to write) has the initial "x." Of the choices, only 或是 huòshì (or) does not have that initial.
body.incorrect: Almost! First identify the initial of the word presented, and then listen to all four words in the choices to identify the same initial by sound.

body.quiz: Which of the following images can be best associated with the word presented?
body.answer: Image of someone reading a book ©iStock
options: Image of someone cutting paper ©iStock
Image of someone writing on paper ©iStock
Image of someone drawing a picture ©iStock
body.correct: You got it! 读 dú means "to read." Of the four images in the choices, the most relevant image to this word is the third one where someone’s reading
body.incorrect: Oops…think about the meaning of the word. Consider what type of activity it describes; then select the appropriate image for it.
